Dear Miss Nivison:
We have requested and received publication rights from mss Youngstrum
at Charles Scribner's Sons to use a poem by .E.A. Robinson, "Richard
Cory." mss Youngstrum suggested that we contact you regarding perÂ¬
mission for the world-wide broadcast rights.
remission to use these materials is being sought by the N.A.E.B. in
conncetion with an arrangement we have with the Voice of America to
develop an English through Poetry series. The 13 commentaries for those
programs are being written by Professor M I#. Rosenthal of Hew York
University. The Voice of America, in turn, working closely with
Professor Rosenthal, will produce 13 quarter-hour radio scripts on the
basis of these commentaries. The radio programs themselves are intended
for broadcast to listeners overseas, and are being designed to appeal
to the listeners interest in poetiy and in the English language.
In each script the poem will be read in its entirety, and the listeners
will also be invited to read the lines aloud in appropriate units after
the radio speaker.
Permission is sought both for the broadcast by the Voice of America to
overseas countries and for broadcast in countries where local radio stations
may receive the taped programs through the United States Information Agency.
Permission has been granted for publication of the poems in any given
country (with the aid or supervision of U.S.I.A.) for distribution free
or at cost to radio listeners, and for eventual publication of the materials
In a similar study booklet to be produced by U.S.I.A. for gratis distribution
to overseas listeners who request such booklets.
This series of 13 different poems is an educational tool not only for the
English language, but for the enjoyment and enrichment of poetry itself.
At the present time we have heard from all but one publisher and we have
been granted permission to use their material gratis or for a nominal fee.
We are hopeful that in view of the nature of this project, we may also
receive the broadcast rights under the same conditions.
